column4: does anyone know why a freshly made raid array (without any partitions on it whatsoever) would return the error that it is in use by the system when i try to format it?
what do you mean? it should have, the bios reports that the array is healthy
well it shows up in jaunty as a single drive
yeah, but the raid technology is fake raid
what is the /dev device name from it ?
ok so what do i do, i would like to set up a raid 0 array that will be accessable from both linux and windows
wow, thats potentially very frustrating, but possible
if you do "sudo fdisk -l /dev/mapper/nvidia_fddaeibi1" what dies it show ?
it says it doesnt contain a valid partition table
which is fine because you've not put a partition on it
what partition tool are you using to partition it ?
, jellow: i get the following form that "From Serverbox (192.168.1.100) icmp_seq=1 Destination Port Unreachable"
so you can't ping that host
